body:
Comment 1: 
replying to 1853:
---
Ok, let me have a look and see if I can come up with a clean way to prevent
expansion without arbitrarily limiting which characters can be put in these
lines.

Otherwise we go with your dance-hindering approach.
---

Please use the safe, conservative approach.  
We are talking about make and sh.  Combined they
have a 70+ year history of security problems.
Trying to be clever always looks like it works
and always fails.

If someone really needs a weird value to be defined
they can use 

// cgo CFLAGS: -Dmytag

and then #ifdef mytag in the C files.
_Owner changed to @niemeyer._ _Status changed to **Accepted**._
